result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis M Vrba was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 07/01/2016 and each month thereafter or penalty of 12 days jail for non-payment.
Costs to be paid along with fine payments.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Request for expungment is denied based on the defendant's age at the time of offense.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis M Vrba

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: scanned and destroyed
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Travis M Vrba in court with Attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Weitzner makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  FINE:  $416.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid at $25.00 per month, commencing 7/1/16, alternate 12 days jail if not paid)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department** 

NOTE:  Request for expungment is denied based on Defendant's age at time of offense.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on June 16, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Travis M Vrba in court with Attorney Cameron Weitzner.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weitzner requests an adjourned date for plea and sentence so Defendant can continue counseling.  State does not object.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Atty Masnica states that the Defendant has enrolled in treatment and requests another further proceeding date in February. Court will set for jury trial.   Bail remains as fixed. Defendant is not to have any violent contact with the victim listed in the complaint.   Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.
